column3: Checkstyle 9.0: Expiring Daemon because JVM heap space is exhausted (8.45 works)
column4: We upgraded to Checkstyle 9.0 and now the Github Ci (linux) runs out of memory:  https://github.com/JabRef/jabref/runs/3560086739  I also tested with increasing the heap space config. But this did not help. Locally on my mac computer it worked  ``` GRADLE_OPTS: -Xmx4g JAVA_OPTS: -Xmx4g ```  Workaround: A downgrade to 8.45-1 fixed the problem

We upgraded Checkstyle from version 8.29 to 8.42, and we're seeing a strange violation around the indentation of annotation arrays.  Example:                                                                                                                                                                                                                ``` PS C:\abl\checkstyle-issue> type checkstyle-config.xml                          PS C:\abl\checkstyle-issue> type Story.java  /**  * A class detailing fields common to all Story types.  */ @JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true) @JsonTypeInfo(use = JsonTypeInfo.Id.NAME, include = JsonTypeInfo.As.PROPERTY) @JsonSubTypes(     {         @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = NonFictionStory.class, name = "NON_FICTION"),         @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = MysteryStory.class, name = "MYSTERY"),         @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = ScienceFictionStory.class, name = "SCIENCE_FICTION"),         @JsonSubTypes.Type(value = HorrorStory.class, name = "HORROR"),     } ) public class Story { }  PS C:\abl\checkstyle-issue> java -jar checkstyle-8.42-all.jar -c checkstyle-config.xml Story.java Starting audit... [ERROR] C:\abl\checkstyle-issue\Story.java:9:9: 'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] [ERROR] C:\abl\checkstyle-issue\Story.java:10:9: 'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] [ERROR] C:\abl\checkstyle-issue\Story.java:11:9: 'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] [ERROR] C:\abl\checkstyle-issue\Story.java:12:9: 'annotation array initialization' child has incorrect indentation level 8, expected level should be 4. [Indentation] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 4 errors. ``` To clear the errors, I have to change the indentation of each @JsonSubTypes.Type in the array to be at the same indentation level as the curly brackets on lines 8 and 13. My understanding is using the default indentation value of 4, each array item should be indented 4 spaces from the curly brackets.  This behavior appears to have been introduced on version 8.40, if I downgrade Checkstyle to version 8.39, I don't have this problem.

column3: Find solution to frequently updating `xwiki-platform` commit in `validation.sh`
column4: We should find some solution for the frequent updates to the `xwiki-platform` commit in `validation.sh`. This has become a frequent maintenance item, and it would be good to find some way to avoid this in the future. Additionally, this failure in CI can confuse new contributors, since it is not immediately apparent to contributors why the build is failing:  ```bash  [ERROR]   The project org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform:13.9-SNAPSHOT (/root/project/.ci-temp/xwiki-platform/pom.xml) has 1 error [ERROR]     Non-resolvable parent POM for org.xwiki.platform:xwiki-platform:13.9-SNAPSHOT: Could not find artifact org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-pom:pom:13.9-SNAPSHOT and 'parent.relativePath' points at no local POM @ line 23, column 11 -> [Help 2] org.apache.maven.model.resolution.UnresolvableModelException: Could not find artifact org.xwiki.commons:xwiki-commons-pom:pom:13.9-SNAPSHOT     at org.apache.maven.project.ProjectModelResolver.resolveModel ...   ``` Full output at https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/9288/workflows/2b9d1f8b-d3cb-41aa-8f9e-70d01fa0d915/jobs/102543 .  Evidence of frequent updates:  ```bash ➜  checkstyle git:(master) git log | grep xwiki     infra: update xwiki commit     infra: update xwiki commit in no-error testing     Issue #9967: Travis is failing on xwiki-platform validation     Issue #9967: fix xwiki validation by usage latest commit with passed build in their CI     minor: return xwiki and equalsverifier to orgin repo usage     infra: move xwiki validation to checkstyle org repo     Issue #9242: Build also xwiki-rendering and xwiki-platform in the no regression travis job     minor: update xwiki to latest commit     Issue #7190: update xwiki SHA     infra: checkout xwiki to stable commit to pass build     config: update wercker to use upstream orekit and xwiki (#7329)     Revert "Issue #7288: fix xwiki build on wercker"     Issue #7288: fix xwiki build on wercker     Revert "Issue #2116: use checkstyle fork of xwiki with fix to pass CI build"     Issue #2116: use checkstyle fork of xwiki with fix to pass CI build     config: update xwiki to address issue of pull #6266     Issue #5812: switch wercker to checkstyle's fork of xwiki     Issue #4582: restored wercker xwiki     Revert "config: travis updated to use new tag from xwiki-commons"     config: travis updated to use new tag from xwiki-commons     Pull #3189: changed xwiki travis testing to fork ...  ```  As the above commit message history shows, it has also been problematic to just use the head commit, since build may not be stable or contain Checkstyle violations, thus failing our CI.

column3: Consider moving pitest from CircleCI to another CI
column4: We run into limit in CircleCI for execution of pitest to be done without paralelization. previosly we had allowance with 4 containers in parallel.  We can consider to move pitest from CicleCi to Travis or github actions.  attention: cirlceCI had feature as artifacts after build, where we store pitest reports, that helps to avoid execution on local for mentors to help contributor with coverage. It would be awesome to preserve this ability (but not critical).

column3: infra: switch travis jobs to github workflow
column4: We need to temporarily move these CI jobs to a github workflow until we restore travis.

column3: Javadoc grammar does not support unicode characters
column4:
We need to revisit #8050. Checkstyle should have the same level of support in our Javadoc grammar that we do in our Java grammar. We cannot claim full unicode character support until we do.  While our ANTLR4 Java grammar now supports unicode characters, our ANTLR4 Javadoc grammar still does not:  ```bash   ➜  src cat Test.java                                          public class Test {      /**      *      * @param ᇤᇥᇦᇧᇨᇩᇪᇫᇬᇭᇮ      */     void aᇭᇮᇯᇰᇱᇲᇳᇴᇵᇶᇷᇸᇹᇺ(int ᇤᇥᇦᇧᇨᇩᇪᇫᇬᇭᇮ) {}   }   ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-9.0-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -T Test.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> Test [1:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:18]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:18]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [7:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [7:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [7:4]     |   |   |--BLOCK_COMMENT_BEGIN -> /* [3:4]     |   |   |   |--COMMENT_CONTENT -> *
     *
     * @param ᇤᇥᇦᇧᇨᇩᇪᇫᇬᇭᇮ
      [3:6]     |   |   |   `--BLOCK_COMMENT_END -> */ [6:5]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [7:4]     |   |--IDENT -> aᇭᇮᇯᇰᇱᇲᇳᇴᇵᇶᇷᇸᇹᇺ [7:9]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [7:24]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [7:25]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [7:25]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [7:25]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [7:25]     |   |       |   `--LITERAL_INT -> int [7:25]     |   |       `--IDENT -> ᇤᇥᇦᇧᇨᇩᇪᇫᇬᇭᇮ [7:29]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [7:40]     |   `--SLIST -> { [7:42]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [7:43]     `--RCURLY -> } [10:0]   ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-9.0-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -J Test.java Exception in thread "main" java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: [ERROR:5] Javadoc comment at column 15 has parse error. Details: no viable alternative at input 'ᇤ' while parsing JAVADOC_TAG         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.DetailNodeTreeStringPrinter.parseJavadocAsDetailNode(DetailNodeTreeStringPrinter.java:71)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.parseAndPrintJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:116)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:97)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:101)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:101)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:101)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:101)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:101)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AstTreeStringPrinter.printJavaAndJavadocTree(AstTreeStringPrinter.java:79)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.runCli(Main.java:306)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.execute(Main.java:191)         at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.Main.main(Main.java:126)   ```  This will be a complicated update, since many elements have regex defined differently/separately:   ```bash    checkstyle git:(master) cat $(find . -name "JavadocLexer.g4") | grep "\[" CUSTOM_NAME: '@' [a-zA-Z0-9:._-]+ {isJavadocTagAvailable}?; PARAMETER_NAME: [a-zA-Z0-9_$]+ -> mode(DEFAULT_MODE); CLASS: [A-Z] [a-zA-Z0-9_$]* {referenceCatched = true;}; MEMBER: [a-zA-Z0-9_$]+ {!insideReferenceArguments}?; ARGUMENT: ([a-zA-Z0-9_$] | '.' | '[' | ']')+ {insideReferenceArguments}?; FIELD_NAME: [a-zA-Z0-9_$]+ -> mode(serialFieldFieldType); FIELD_TYPE: [a-zA-Z0-9_$]+ -> mode(DEFAULT_MODE); CLASS_NAME: ([a-zA-Z0-9_$] | '.')+ -> mode(DEFAULT_MODE); CustomName1: '@' [a-zA-Z0-9:._-]+ {recognizeXmlTags=false;} Brackets: '{' (~[}] | Brackets)* '}' -> type(CHAR); Text: ~[}] -> type(CHAR); fragment JavaLetter: [A-Za-z_$]; fragment JavaLetterOrDigit: [0-9A-Za-z_$]; HEXDIGIT    :   [a-fA-F0-9] ; DIGIT       :   [0-9] ;             :   [:a-zA-Z] FragmentReference: ([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')+       | ([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')* '#' [a-zA-Z0-9_-]+ ( '(' (([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')+ | ',' | ' ')* ')' )? ATTR_VALUE  : '"' ~[ mode(serialFieldFieldType); FIELD_TYPE: [a-zA-Z0-9_$]+ -> mode(DEFAULT_MODE); CLASS_NAME: ([a-zA-Z0-9_$] | '.')+ -> mode(DEFAULT_MODE); CustomName1: '@' [a-zA-Z0-9:._-]+ {recognizeXmlTags=false;} Brackets: '{' (~[}] | Brackets)* '}' -> type(CHAR); Text: ~[}] -> type(CHAR);     : [a-zA-Z$_]     | ~[�-�-�]     | [�-�] [�-�]     | [0-9] HEXDIGIT    :   [a-fA-F0-9] ; DIGIT       :   [0-9] ;             :   [:a-zA-Z] FragmentReference: ([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')+       | ([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')* '#' [a-zA-Z0-9_-]+ ( '(' (([a-zA-Z0-9_-] | '.')+ | ',' | ' ')* ')' )? ATTR_VALUE  : '"' ~[

column3: config: remove old antrl reference from version plugin config
Refactor XdocsPagesTest to use some annotation to specify the property type
column4: We have a rich set of [property types](https://checkstyle.org/property_types.html). And a [check](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/internal/XdocsPagesTest.java) to ensure that all properties are documented in the right way. Sometimes the property type cannot be inferred from the field type. In this case the type is hardcoded in the `XdocsPagesTest`.  ### How it works now  ```java         String result = null;         if (("SuppressionCommentFilter".equals(sectionName)                 || "SuppressWithNearbyCommentFilter".equals(sectionName)                 || "SuppressWithPlainTextCommentFilter".equals(sectionName))                     && ("checkFormat".equals(propertyName)                         || "messageFormat".equals(propertyName)                         || "idFormat".equals(propertyName)                         || "influenceFormat".equals(propertyName))                 || ("RegexpMultiline".equals(sectionName)                     || "RegexpSingleline".equals(sectionName)                     || "RegexpSinglelineJava".equals(sectionName))                     && "format".equals(propertyName)) {             // dynamic custom expression             result = "Regular Expression";         }         // 100+ similar lines ```   ### Annotation-based proposal  ```java // XdocsPagesTest         String result = null;         final PropertyType propertyType = fieldClass.getAnnotation(PropertyType.class);         if (propertyType != null) {             result = propertyType.value().getDescription();          }         else {             result = fieldClass.getSimpleName();         }  // SomeCheck.java      @PropertyType(REGEXP)     private String format = "$.";   // PropertyType.java      @Target(ElementType.FIELD)     @Retention(RetentionPolicy.SOURCE)     public @interface PropertyType {         CustomPropertyType value();     }      public enum CustomPropertyType {         REGEXP("Regular Expression"),         TOKEN("Set of tokens"),         ;          private final String description;          CustomPropertyType(String description) {              this.description = description;         }          public String getDescription() {             return description;         }     }  ```  This can be used to fix #10086

column3: Remove dependency on Powermock from tests
column4: We have a number of Powermock powered tests: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/tree/master/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/internal/powermock  We need them for coverage testing. Mostly because Mockito framework does not support mocking of a static methods prior to version 3.4.0. For today, the Powermock is not compatible with JDK17 and abandoned. This is a blocker for the future development. We can not set up a JDK17 build (#10905), so we can not test JDK17-specific features.  But we can replace `PowerMock.mockStatic` with `Mockito.mockStatic` if we switch to new [mockito-inline](https://mvnrepository.com/artifact/org.mockito/mockito-inline) framework.  Unfortunately, both frameworks (mockito-inline and powermock) cannot coexist. So we need to drop the Powermocks library first. Some work will be done in #7368.  The goal of this issue is to replace the Powermock dependency with a recent Mockito and keep as much coverage as possible.  Started here: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10899#issuecomment-962649128

We had a rule for our eclipse-plugin projects `      ` because Eclipse internationalization requires this trailing comment for Non-Localized Strings.  Since some versions (I believe https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/commit/ebef3bd59fdc2c97587a67bc59d57af6ecbb9072, introduced in 8.41), this did no longer work, I needed to change it to  `      ` because in `isLegalSingleLineComment`, the commentText is extracted with comment.substring(1).trim(); Why would the first character of a comment be ignored?  I have read the check documentation: https://checkstyle.org/config_misc.html#TrailingComment I have downloaded the latest checkstyle (9.2) from: https://checkstyle.org/cmdline.html#Download_and_Run I have executed the cli and showed it below, as cli describes the problem better than 1,000 words:  ``` (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ javac cs/C.java (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ cat trailingChecks.xml                                                    (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ cat cs/C.java  package cs;  public class C {      public static void main(String[] args) {         System.out.println("foo"); //$NON-NLS-1$     }  } (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ RUN_LOCALE="-Duser.language=en -Duser.country=US" (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c trailingChecks.xml cs/C.java  Starting audit... [WARN] /exchange/ws/fips/cs/src/cs/C.java:6:36: Don't use trailing comments. [TrailingComment] Audit done. ```  When I change the config, it works: ``` (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ cat trailingChecks.xml                                                    (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c trailingChecks.xml cs/C.java  Starting audit... Audit done. ```  It is not caused by the escaped dollar sign, as removing it in both the Java class and the config does again not work: ``` (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ cat cs/C.java  package cs;  public class C {      public static void main(String[] args) {         System.out.println("foo"); //NON-NLS-1$     }  } (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ cat trailingChecks.xml                                                    (base) schwering /ws/fips/cs/src$ java $RUN_LOCALE -jar checkstyle-9.2-all.jar -c trailingChecks.xml cs/C.java  Starting audit... [WARN] /exchange/ws/fips/cs/src/cs/C.java:6:36: Don't use trailing comments. [TrailingComment] Audit done. ```

column3: Refactor input files in check tests
column4: This issue if part of the **Adaptation of Behavior Driven Development ideas for testing of source code validation algorithms** project.  Update of all inputs to have comment with config on top of file. **Important**: Always keep extra 2 empty lines after last property, to let extend  Example: Original: ``` package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.naming.parametername; import java.io.*;  /* Config:  *  * format = "^NO_WAY_MATEY$"  */  final class MyClass {  private final static int fourth_Const4 = 50; // violation  } ```  Updated: ``` /* ParameterName applyToPublic = (default)true applyToProtected = (default)true applyToPackage = (default)true applyToPrivate = (default)true format = "^NO_WAY_MATEY$"   */  package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.checks.naming.parametername; import java.io.*;  final class MyClass {  private final static int fourth_Const4 = 50; // violation  } ```

This issue if part of the **Adaptation of Behavior Driven Development ideas for testing of source code validation algorithms**  project.   New parser should be able to extract: - Check name or check class #10077 - Configuration properties #10141 - Violation list #10078 - Extract violation message #10079  Input example: ``` /* ParameterName applyToPublic = (default)true applyToProtected = (default)true applyToPackage = (default)true applyToPrivate = (default)true format = "^NO_WAY_MATEY$"   */  class MyClass {   public final static int FIRST_CONSTANT1 = 10;   protected final static int SECOND_CONSTANT2 = 100;   final static int third_Constant3 = 1000; // violation 'third_Constant3'   private final static int fourth_Const4 = 50; // violation  }  ```  Parser will be located at `com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.bdd` in `test` folder  @romani @shashwatj07 please have a look

column3: Update existing Input files to follow 100 line limit
column4: This is umbrella issue to resolve all suppression from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10624  ALL PRs should reference this issue, it is better to resolve few suppression per each PR, not all.  ideas: - change indentation of file to be +2 based; - change names of variables or identifiers or shorten string values or ... - move problematic code to special Input file. - if not possible to escape line limit violation - move special chunk of code to special new Input file and suppress whole file permanently with definition of reason in comment.  Example of expected update: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/11037/files

This is just a test related to https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/527#issuecomment-927211709  Diff Regression projects: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/eda82b4710a94cfb14779a8752784545/raw/f28735639e0904aa675a874a16042084ebb14e9c/projects.properties  Diff Regression config: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/checkstyle/contribution/master/checkstyle-tester/my_check.xml  Diff Regression patch config: https://gist.githubusercontent.com/nmancus1/19560c1866ca4eabbf3d3ad8a90a213d/raw/9f62a21fa2fd5297a18b99e0f5ef4080e114cf4c/patchconfig.xml

column3: infra: Set permissions required by the workflow
column4: This fixes the `diff_report.yml` workflow, which is currently not working properly:  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/runs/4446596762?check_suite_focus=true#step:2:12  The repo settings for actions permission have been changed to:  >Read repository contents permission >Workflows have read permissions in the repository for the contents scope only.   The `diff_report.yml` workflow needs the `pull-requests: write` permission so it can react and reply to PR comments. This PR sets the required permissions to fix the issue.  It's still worth taking even if you undo the repo settings change; it limits the permissions for this workflow to the minimum required.  Setting "pull-requests: write​" is needed so the workflow can comment on the PR with the diff results. The full list of what that permission allows is given here: https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/permissions-required-for-github-apps#permission-on-pull-requests

column3: Add support for file path in Inline Config Parser
column4: This deals with Inline Config for 3 special cases: 1. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/710dc775ded898c478ef692311ee3f2f05a92182/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportControlCheckTest.java#L67-L68 For Inline Config, this will be dealt with:  > file = (file)ABCD.xml  This resolves to the absolute system path to the resource which is different for Linux and Windows. Example:  > C:\checkstyle\src\test\resources\com\puppycrawl\tools\checkstyle\checks\imports\importcontrol\ABCD.xml  2. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/710dc775ded898c478ef692311ee3f2f05a92182/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportControlCheckTest.java#L286-L287 For Inline Config, this will be dealt with:  > file = (file)(resource)ABCD.xml  This resolves to the relative Linux style path from package root. Example:  > /com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/importcontrol/ABCD.xml  3. https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/710dc775ded898c478ef692311ee3f2f05a92182/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportControlCheckTest.java#L314-L315 For Inline Config, this will be dealt with:  > file = (file)(uri)ABCD.xml  This resolves to the URI String according to Example:  > file:/C:/checkstyle/src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/importcontrol/ABCD.xml

column3: Add Configuration.getPropertyNames and Configuration.getProperty and deprecate getAttributeNames getAttribute methods
column4: there is no Atributes in Checkstyle, we have properties. https://checkstyle.org/config.html#Properties  Attribute term probably come to us from XML config, as the only way to configure checkstyle. But we consider other way of doing it configs: yml, .... .  API should be consistent with general documentation, and implementation details should not be leaked in API.  detected at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10142#discussion_r657443405

There are test cases, when `CheckstyleException` is expected   https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/99fea77af6a40985ca3d3efe6a26df7cdbdf7859/src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/ImportControlCheckTest.java#L150  Instead of try-catching, we can provide information about checkstyle error, that user will face with maybe via additional property inside input file  @romani @shashwatj07

The error will not be displayed, maybe i have problem with configuration file ?  ```                                          ``` ``` public enum Bar {   FOO(""),   BAR("");            private String a; } ``` I tried with Maven Checkstyle plugin 3.1.2 which uses 8.43 and also tried overriding its version to the latest Checkstyle

column3: SEMI Token: Non-standard locations in tree for DetailAST items
column4: Taken from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/950 ,  When traversing the DetailAST tree to build a custom checker, I notice some of the same types are found in different areas, either as a child or as a sibling. One example is "return" has ";" as a child while an expression has ";" as a sibling. It is making traversing the tree and finding items a little bit more tricky than it is needed. It would be much easier if they were to be found in the same location.  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     void method() {         int a = 0, b = 0;          // line 6 below         if (a == 1) return;         // line 9 below         if (a == 2)             b = 3;     } } ````  Create the following tree: ````     |      |--LITERAL_IF -> if [6:8]     |      |  |--LPAREN -> ( [6:11]     |      |  |--EXPR -> EXPR [6:14]     |      |  |  `--EQUAL -> == [6:14]     |      |  |      |--IDENT -> a [6:12]     |      |  |      `--NUM_INT -> 1 [6:17]     |      |  |--RPAREN -> ) [6:18]     |      |  `--LITERAL_RETURN -> return [6:20]     |      |      `--SEMI -> ; [6:26] //  if [8:8]     |      |  |--LPAREN -> ( [8:11]     |      |  |--EXPR -> EXPR [8:14]     |      |  |  `--EQUAL -> == [8:14]     |      |  |      |--IDENT -> a [8:12]     |      |  |      `--NUM_INT -> 2 [8:17]     |      |  |--RPAREN -> ) [8:18]     |      |  |--EXPR -> EXPR [9:14]     |      |  |  `--ASSIGN -> = [9:14]     |      |  |      |--IDENT -> b [9:12]     |      |  |      `--NUM_INT -> 3 [9:16]     |      |  `--SEMI -> ; [9:17] //

column3: Fix up messages - mojibake, lone apostrophes and accidental apostrophes substitutes
column4: Some message translations features:  1. Mojibake. 2. Lone apostrophes (they should be doubled due to escaping). 3. Accidental apostrophes substitutes (` and ’ instead of ').  Disclaimer: Since #10811 and #10812 are too fat to be properly and fully peer-reviewed, I am resubmiting them in small baby-steps issues and commits.

column3: minor: refactor few if statements to simplify them

column4: Similar to https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7531   ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class TestClass {     void method() { // test     } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                            $ java -jar checkstyle-8.43-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ````  MatchXpath can't flag comments because it is not a comment aware check.  I don't believe it is at all related to PR #9832 since xpath relies on the tokens given to it and checks that aren't comment aware won't receive comments.

column3: Extract parameter type from nested array declarator brackets
column4: Similar to #3145 , during my work on upgrading to ANTLR4, I have found the same construct causing weird line/ column numbers:  ```bash  ➜  src cat Test.java public class Test {     public void m12(String[] p1) {     }      public void m16(String[]... p1) {     } }  ➜  src javac Test.java  ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.43-all.jar -t Test.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> Test [1:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:18]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:18]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [2:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:4]     |   |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [2:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:11]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [2:11]     |   |--IDENT -> m12 [2:16]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [2:19]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [2:26]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [2:26]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:26]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:26]     |   |       |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:26]     |   |       |       |--IDENT -> String [2:20]     |   |       |       `--RBRACK -> ] [2:27]     |   |       `--IDENT -> p1 [2:29]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [2:31]     |   `--SLIST -> { [2:33]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [3:4]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [5:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [5:4]     |   |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [5:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [5:11]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [5:11]     |   |--IDENT -> m16 [5:16]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [5:19]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [5:26]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [5:26]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [5:26]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [5:26]     |   |       |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [5:26]     |   |       |       |--IDENT -> String [5:20]     |   |       |       `--RBRACK -> ] [5:27]     |   |       |--ELLIPSIS -> ... [5:28]     |   |       `--IDENT -> p1 [5:32]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [5:34]     |   `--SLIST -> { [5:36]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [6:4]     `--RCURLY -> } [7:0]  ```  This should be:  ```bash  ➜  src java -jar ~/IdeaProjects/checkstyle/target/checkstyle-8.44-SNAPSHOT-all.jar -t Test.java  CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:7] |--IDENT -> Test [1:13] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:18]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:18]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [2:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:4]     |   |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [2:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:11]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [2:11]     |   |--IDENT -> m12 [2:16]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [2:19]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [2:20]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [2:20]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [2:20]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [2:20]     |   |       |   |--IDENT -> String [2:20]     |   |       |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [2:26]     |   |       |       `--RBRACK -> ] [2:27]     |   |       `--IDENT -> p1 [2:29]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [2:31]     |   `--SLIST -> { [2:33]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [3:4]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [5:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [5:4]     |   |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [5:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [5:11]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [5:11]     |   |--IDENT -> m16 [5:16]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [5:19]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [5:20]     |   |   `--PARAMETER_DEF -> PARAMETER_DEF [5:20]     |   |       |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [5:20]     |   |       |--TYPE -> TYPE [5:20]     |   |       |   |--IDENT -> String [5:20]     |   |       |   `--ARRAY_DECLARATOR -> [ [5:26]     |   |       |       `--RBRACK -> ] [5:27]     |   |       |--ELLIPSIS -> ... [5:28]     |   |       `--IDENT -> p1 [5:32]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [5:34]     |   `--SLIST -> { [5:36]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [6:4]     `--RCURLY -> } [7:0]  ```  You can see the diff here: https://www.diffchecker.com/dY7Uy4TY

column3: Forbid usage of deprecated API Configuration.xxxAttributeXxxx
column4: see https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10164  We need to disallow usage of deprecated API

column3: ArrayTypeStyle false positives in nested generics
column4: Rule : [ArrayTypeStyle](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_misc.html#ArrayTypeStyle)  The `ArrayTypeStyle` seems to fail when checking the declaration inside nested generics. It works as expected with the 8.43 but fails with the [8.44](https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/releasenotes.html#Release_8.44).  ```java // Test.java public class Test {      protected Pair[] values1; // OK     protected Pair[] values2; // OK     protected Pair[] values3a; // KO!     protected Pair<         Integer,         Pair<             String,             Pair         >[]     >[] values3b; // OK, but in fact it's the same as "values3a" with another format      protected static class Pair {         protected L key;         protected R value;     } } ```  ```xml                                              ```  ```bash $ java -jar checkstyle-8.44-all.jar -c checkstyle.xml Test.java ``` ``` Starting audit... [ERROR] /home/junior/Downloads/Test.java:5:66: Array brackets at illegal position. [ArrayTypeStyle] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 1 errors ```

column3: Revert "Issue #10778: switch to ppc64le arch to avoid usage of paid credits"
Issue #10684: Pitests to produce artifact on all runs at master
column4: Resolves: #10684  Please see artifacts being produced after merge: https://github.com/AkMo3/checkstyle/actions/runs/1154147702

column3: Issue #10188: Migrate Pitests from CircleCI to Github actions
column4: Resolves: #10188   Current Configuration Timings: 1. GitHub actions: 9 min  2. CircleCI: 18 min   All these timings are for individual build times considering no backlogs are there. Goals achieved: 1. All tests (including Pitests) run parallel now. 2. pitests are reafactored to not use parallelization on containers and we still have same parallelization on job level.  2. Pitest artifacts are preserved BUT as zips - https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/actions/runs/1044325180 ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/127785463-2493d131-cb89-4bca-ad98-5e7413f78e5a.png)   Current issues:  1. If Pitest fails, artifacts are not created for that specific pitest. Eg: [Pitest-main](https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/runs/3101542141?check_suite_focus=true) 2. pitest-main fails due to unknown reasons. To be fixed in #9351. Till the time, suppression is being added.

column4: Related to discussion at https://github.com/checkstyle/contribution/pull/527#issuecomment-969376283 , allowing file exclusions in diff report generation will permit us to run check regression on newer openjdk's.  I do not think that github actions will use the proposed changes in this PR to execute a diff report created by a comment in this PR, so we will need to merge this, then try https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10911 again to show that exclusions work. I will also update #10911 to use openjdk16.

Proposal:  ``` /*  AnnotationLocationAnnotation  allowSamelineSingleParameterlessAnnotation = true  allowSamelineParameterizedAnnotation = false  allowSamelineMultipleAnnotations = false  tokens = ["ANNOTATION_DEF", "ANNOTATION_FIELD_DEF"]   SuppressionXpathFilter file = config/suppressions.xml optional=false */ ```  we know all filters we support, so we can have hardcoded map of filters to know where to put as child- to Treewalker or Checker.

column3: Use cache for maven dependencies to speed up drone io builds
column4: Problem: execution of checkstyle build take a lot of time on CI systems, and some of it is spent on downloading dependencies.  Proposed solution: store maven dependencies as s3 cache and download them as a part of preparation for builds.  Some CI systems has support for this feature, e.g. in [travis](https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/caching/) and [drone](http://plugins.drone.io/drone-plugins/drone-s3-cache/)  UPDATE: we starting to use sourceforge file system for maven repository - https://sourceforge.net/projects/checkstyle/files/drone-io/ , s3 will cost us 15$ a month, wedo not have sponsorship for this details: https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10679#discussion_r693565229

column3: Implement enhanced version of verify with bdd parser
column4: prerequisite for #10390  This issue if part of the Adaptation of Behavior Driven Development ideas for testing of source code validation algorithms project.  Implement enhanced version of verify with bdd parser, that will be second execution after existing verify method  new method execution flow: - call `AbstractModuleTestSupport.verify` method - invoke input parser and extract config and violation - compare parsed config name, properties and violation list with that were passed to method as arguments - _call second time `AbstractModuleTestSupport.verify` with parsed configs_ - @romani should we?

column3: Issue #7368: replace Whitebox with JDK17-compatible utility methods
column4: Part of #7368   This PR if a prerequisite for enabling JDK17 build. We are doing a bit of reflection in the tests, with `Whitebox` class from Powermocks library. The problem is that `Whitebox` blindly makes accessible every field in the hierarchy: https://github.com/powermock/powermock/issues/1094  This PR introduces some `Whitebox`-compatible methods in the `TestUtil` class. With two differences: these methods make accessible only the requested field/method, not all of them including methods from `Object` class and do not "unwrap" `InvocationTargetException` cause.  The import config now forbids usage of `Whitebox` and low-level reflection API (with some exceptions).

Part of #10932   It is no more possible to mock `System.exit` nor replace `ordinal` field of an `enum`. For the fields `System.err` and `System.out` there is a workaround. We can replace them with a custom stream.  Limitation: ``` ✔ ~/java/github/romani/checkstyle [pbludov/issue-10932-main L|✚ 1]  $ git diff diff --git a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java index 8d5a261..ae0724d 100644 --- a/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java +++ b/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/Main.java @@ -149,7 +149,9 @@ public final class Main {                  System.err.println(errorCounterViolation.getViolation());              }          } -        ExitHelper.exit(exitStatus); +        if (exitStatus != 0) { +            ExitHelper.exit(exitStatus); +        }      }        /** @@ -878,9 +880,7 @@ public final class Main {           * @noinspection CallToSystemExit           */          private static void exit(int code) { -            if (code != 0) { -                System.exit(code); -            } +            System.exit(code);          }        } ```  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/812984/143880781-df5dd52b-1bc4-44d2-b68e-34b4370c66ab.png) So new class is created, to hide this uncoverage.

column3: Release notes should mention that `CheckUtil#createFullType` has been removed.
column4: Noticed while running check regression reports for #10979 with Sevntu checks, the commit that removes `CheckUtil#createFullType` (https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10839/commits/7462b00c2f0d470be6d3d8825f83c717cc5696aa), does not mention that this method has been removed. `createFullType` is used in two sevntu checks:  ```bash ➜  sevntu-checks git:(master) grep -R createFullType src/main/java/com/github/sevntu/checkstyle/checks/coding/IllegalCatchExtendedCheck.java:        final FullIdent ident = CheckUtil.createFullType(excType); src/main/java/com/github/sevntu/checkstyle/checks/coding/AvoidNotShortCircuitOperatorsForBooleanCheck.java:                CheckUtil.createFullType(node.findFirstToken(TokenTypes.TYPE));  ```  It is likely that `CheckUtil#createFullType` is also used in third party checks, so I think we should mention that this method has been removed in release notes (perhaps as breaking change?).  Edit: Sevntu PR at https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/pull/876

Noticed failure at https://app.circleci.com/pipelines/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/9288/workflows/2b9d1f8b-d3cb-41aa-8f9e-70d01fa0d915/jobs/102543, we need to update xwiki commit sha to latest head commit.

Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10574 :  ![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/31252532/129114663-9c42a194-ff6f-4145-953e-24c4c5897f0a.png)   pitest naming scheme should be consistent in github CI.

Noticed at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10437/checks?check_run_id=3297051073 and https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10435, sometimes pitest is reporting that `if (binOpList.isEmpty())` in `JavaAstVisitor.java` does not pass when we mutate the condition to `true`. The added string concatenation in this file should guarantee a `StackOverflow` without the iteration in `visitBinOp`, thus killing the mutation.

New rule [CognitiveComplexity](https://pmd.github.io/pmd-6.35.0/pmd_rules_java_design.html#cognitivecomplexity) reports 3 violations: ``` [INFO] PMD Failure: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.internal.AllChecksTest:399 Rule:CognitiveComplexity Priority:3 The method 'validateAllCheckTokensAreReferencedInConfigFile(String, Configuration, Map, boolean)' has a cognitive complexity of 24, current threshold is 22. [INFO] PMD Failure: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.internal.XdocsPagesTest:968 Rule:CognitiveComplexity Priority:3 The method 'getModulePropertyExpectedTypeName(String, Class, Object, String)' has a cognitive complexity of 68, current threshold is 22. [INFO] PMD Failure: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.internal.XdocsPagesTest:1086 Rule:CognitiveComplexity Priority:3 The method 'getModulePropertyExpectedValue(String, String, Field, Class, Object)' has a cognitive complexity of 316, current threshold is 22. ``` These methods are really big and should be refactored. All of them are from internal tests.  THIS ISSUE is partially fixed, see comment below.  _Originally posted by @pbludov in https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10055#issuecomment-853668873_

move Inputs that cannot have or no benefit of header inlined config to permanent suppression section:  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/82c124e67c63d2764e32ebb4855f51df3685b092/config/checkstyle_input_suppressions.xml#L22  reword section: ` ` to ` `  it will be section for permanent suppression. Please do the same for "StyleValidationCommentInInputs"   following java classes (and there respective Inputs should be moved to permanent suppression): asttreestringprinter detailastimpl header regexpheader nocodeinfile javadocdetailnodeparser javadocpropertiesgenerator newlineatendoffile InputAllChecksDefaultConfig.java - we cannot use bdd here. InputPackageNamesLoaderNotXml.java  - there is no intend to validate this file, used for different purpose. InputXpathFilterElementSuppressByXpath - not used for Checks validation InputDetailAstImplJustToMakeStackoverflowError - not used for Checks validation InputChecker - not used for Checks validation InputCheckerClearDetailAstLazyLoadCache  - not used for Checks validation (if I missed something, please extend list)  All other should have separate issues and excuse comment should be "until #xxxxxxx", like for "indentation", "filters"  Indentation: it is already on bdd, but on different implementation, lets keep it as is for now as such approach validate a lot more than our general bdd concept. Please put all indentation in permanent suppression and please create issue to try to move Indentation to dbb, this issue should outside of gsoc21. All indentation group of suppression please squash into single suppression by package name like "indentation/*" and place a comment above it "until #xxxxxx".  Filters:  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10653

Javadoc ParseError on content with link tags
column4: leads to parse error (original in german)      Der Javadoc-Kommentar an Position 23 führt zu einem Parserfehler. Details: no viable alternative at input '.' beim Parsen von     JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG [NonEmptyAtclauseDescription]  what is freely translated to english      The javadoc comment  on position 23 led to a pasring error. Details: no viable alternative at input '.' while parsing     JAVADOC_INLINE_TAG [NonEmptyAtclauseDescription]  for the correct javdoc of      /**      * Gets the string representation of the current Reversi board as a two      * dimensional matrix with tiles of of the human player as {@code 'X'}      * ({@link #Player.HUMAN.toString()}), of the machine player as {@code 'O'}      * ({@link #Player.MACHINE.toString()}), and unset/empty slots as {@code      * '.'} ({@link #Player.UNSET.toString()}). The columns are separated by a      * simple whitespace character.      *       * @return The string representation where every row of the game is a      *         separate line.      */     @Override     public String toString() { ... }  At least if removing all three occurrances `({@link...)`, the parse error vanishes.  Thanks,  Chris

column3: Travis Build Failures: not enough credits
column4: It has been recently identified that travis has been disabled for the last 1-2 months.  Admins are currently working to fully resolve the issue but travis ran in a PR and is failing. We need to look into the issues and fix the CI so it runs green again.  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10777 https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10777/checks?check_run_id=3515099527  > 27971.4 | openjdk8 | DESC="NoErrorTest - Hibernate Search" | Linux | failed  ```` [INFO] --- maven-enforcer-plugin:3.0.0-M3:enforce (enforce-common-rules) @ hibernate-search-parent --- [WARNING] Rule 0: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.RequireJavaVersion failed with message: Detected JDK Version: 1.8.0-252 is not in the allowed range [11,). [WARNING] Rule 1: org.apache.maven.plugins.enforcer.RequireMavenVersion failed with message: Detected Maven Version: 3.6.3 is not in the allowed range 3.8.1. [INFO] ------------------------------------------------------------------------ ... [ERROR] Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-enforcer-plugin:3.0.0-M3:enforce (enforce-common-rules) on project hibernate-search-parent: Some Enforcer rules have failed. Look above for specific messages explaining why the rule failed. -> [Help 1] org.apache.maven.lifecycle.LifecycleExecutionException: Failed to execute goal org.apache.maven.plugins:maven-enforcer-plugin:3.0.0-M3:enforce (enforce-common-rules) on project hibernate-search-parent: Some Enforcer rules have failed. Look above for specific messages explaining why the rule failed. ````  > 27971.5 | openjdk8 | DESC="NoErrorTest - checkstyle's sevntu" | Linux | failed  ```` [INFO] --- maven-checkstyle-plugin:3.1.2:check (sevntu-checkstyle-check) @ checkstyle --- [INFO] There are 2 errors reported by Checkstyle 9.1-SNAPSHOT with /home/travis/build/checkstyle/checkstyle/config/checkstyle_sevntu_checks.xml ruleset. [ERROR] src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/ThreadModeSettings.java:[29,33] (extension) AvoidDefaultSerializableInInnerClasses: Inner class should not implement default Serializable interface. [ERROR] src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/api/Violation.java:[49,5] (extension) AvoidDefaultSerializableInInnerClasses: Inner class should not implement default Serializable interface. ````  ----------------------  Below is the correspondence with Travis Support to resolve the issue with travis not running:  Checkstyle: ```` We have just recently noticed that for the past 1-2 months our travis builds have not been running. When viewing https://app.travis-ci.com/github/checkstyle/checkstyle/requests it gives the following messages:  Owner checkstyle does not have enough credits. Builds have been temporarily disabled for public repositories due to a negative credit balance. Please go to the Plan page to replenish your credit balance or alter your Consume paid credits for OSS setting.   I don't understand why it says our plan changed on June 24, 2021, why we have credits, and why we are being charged credits now and not before? ````  Travis Support: ```` We have changed our plan few months back and notified all our customers about this new pricing plan changes[1]. Now we have free plan with 10K credits limit only. So for OSS credits you need to qualify with criteria. You can find information about our OSS  credits from this page[2].   We offer an Open Source Subscription for free to non-commercial open-source projects.   Does this sound like you and your project? We'd be very happy to support you!  ````  Checkstyle: ```` I have looked over the OSS requirements and I do believe our project qualifies for it. I am an admin of the project. ````  Travis Support: ```` Open source has always been and always will be at the core of what Travis CI stands for. After reviewing your open source qualifications, I am pleased to notify you that 25k credits were added to your account allowing you to resume running OSS builds. When your credits begin running low again, please reach back out to the Support team.  Credits Consumption Metric OS.              # CREDITS PER STARTED BUILD MINUTE Linux.          10 Experimental FreeBSD.         10 Windows.         20 MacOS.         50   Please let us know if you have any questions!   Thanks and happy building!, ````  https://docs.travis-ci.com/user/billing-overview/#partner-queue-solution ```` Partner Queue Solution is a solution for infrastructure sponsored by our Partners with OSS in mind which can be used completely for free. Currently, it includes:      IBM CPU builds in IBM Cloud (sponsored by IBM)     ARM64 CPU builds in Equinix Metal (former Packet) infrastructure (sponsored by ARM)  This is available only to Open Source Software repositories.  In order to run a job using Partner Queue Solution, use the following .travis.yml tags in your public repository:  os: linux arch:   - arm64   - ppc64le   - s390x  YAML  Please see our Build Environment overview and Building for Multiple CPU architectures pages for more details.  In order to start a build in the Usage based Plan, a positive credits balance is required in the account (at least 1 credit). The build job under Partner Queue Solution costs 0 credits per started minute. At the moment of introducing Partner Queue Solution active accounts on the Usage based Plans, including the Free Plan, with a balance of zero or fewer credits, balance is updated to hold 1 credit. Thus everybody can use Partner Queues without requesting Travis CI support to grant additional credits. If you run into a negative account balance after that, you still need to file an additional request.  In the case of Concurrency based Plans, you can use the above infrastructure for OSS builds without any credits in your account. ````  If any problem happening, there is hidden tab in Travis to show parse errors https://app.travis-ci.com/github/sevntu-checkstyle/checkstyle-samples/requests

column3: Remove curly braces usage for javadoc tags in translations
column4: Issue come from https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10854#discussion_r736815881_  There are failures in tests when autoescape for single quotes added.  I suggest to remove usages of curly braces in messages. At the moment there are only 2 messages (in english + entries in other langs) ```  grep -R --include "messages.properties" "'{'" . ./src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/annotation/messages.properties:annotation.missing.override=Must include @java.lang.Override annotation when '{'@inheritDoc'}' Javadoc tag exists. ./src/main/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/javadoc/messages.properties:javadoc.invalidInheritDoc=Invalid use of the '{'@inheritDoc'}' tag. ```  So we can change it to  ``` Must include @java.lang.Override annotation when '@inheritDoc' Javadoc tag exists. ``` and  ``` Invalid use of the '@inheritDoc' tag. ```  Other option is to disable escape and manage escapes by yourselves (user has to add escapes in crowdin), but I think it is not a very convinient way.

column3: Issue #9876: Fix default scope for enum/interface/annotation members
column4: Issue #9876   The method `ScopeUtils.getScopeFromMods` always return `package` scope if no scope is explicitly set. There is a local workaround for this bug in `MissingJavadocMethodCheck.calculateScope` and `MethodCountCheck.ctor`. This PR removes these workarounds and fixes the broken method. column3: Issue #10138: test ecj jar after download to prevent hidden error of …
column4: Issue #10138  …download non-existing jar   ``` ✔ ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [master|✔]  $ jar -tvf pom.xml java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:225) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:155) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:126) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.list(Main.java:1115) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.run(Main.java:293) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.main(Main.java:1288) ✘-1 ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [master|✔]  ```  ``` ✔ ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [Issue-10138 L|✔]   $ jar -tvf ~/.m2/repository/junit/junit/4.11/junit-4.11.jar      0 Wed Nov 14 20:21:28 PST 2012 META-INF/    103 Wed Nov 14 20:21:26 PST 2012 META-INF/MANIFEST.MF      0 Wed Nov 14 20:21:24 PST 2012 junit/      0 Wed Nov 14 20:21:26 PST 2012 junit/extensions/ ....    123 Wed Nov 14 20:21:26 PST 2012 org/junit/runners/package-info.class ✔ ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [Issue-10138 L|✔] ```  main point is that exit code from such command, it will fail on non jar file.  suppression of output works fine: ``` ✘-1 ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [Issue-10138 L|✔]  $ jar -tvf ~/.m2/repository/junit/junit/4.11/junit-4.11.jar > /dev/null ✔ ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [Issue-10138 L|✔]  $ jar -tvf pom.xml > /dev/null java.util.zip.ZipException: error in opening zip file 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.open(Native Method) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:225) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:155) 	at java.util.zip.ZipFile.(ZipFile.java:126) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.list(Main.java:1115) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.run(Main.java:293) 	at sun.tools.jar.Main.main(Main.java:1288) ✘-1 ~/java/github/checkstyle/checkstyle [Issue-10138 L|✔]  ```

Replace ANTLR2 dependencies in unit test inputs
column4: In support of https://github.com/checkstyle-antlr4/checkstyle-antlr4/issues/6, we should remove all ANTLR2 dependencies from unit test inputs. Since ANTLR2 is used in a few import check inputs, we should replace it's usages with ANTLR4 imports or move the files to non-compilable directories. There's no reason to wait to replace these imports or move these files to non-compilable directories, this would just make for more code to review at the time of ANTLR4 Java grammar project completion.  ```bash  ➜  checkstyle git:(master) grep -R antlr | grep -v "v4" | grep Input | grep -v "noncompilable" src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/customimportorder/InputCustomImportOrderSpanMultipleLines.java:import antlr.*; // warn src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/customimportorder/InputCustomImportOrderSpanMultipleLines.java:import antlr.Token; src/test/resources/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/checks/imports/customimportorder/InputCustomImportOrderSingleLine.java:import antlr.*; src/test/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/grammar/AstRegressionTest.java:import antlr.ParserSharedInputState;    ```

column3: Add support for default IntelliJ IDEA formatting
column4: In particular, I have to change java import order performed by IDEA by default to overcome Checkstyle's error `Wrong order for `. See the issue #525 closed without addressing.

column3: minor: fixes comment and token type counting in tests
column4: Identified when working on the backport.  Comment was originally designed to warn users to not just update the count for no reason to pass the test. The new tokens need to be added as well as updating the count. The comment should stick to the count and the wording was made a bit clearer to help that.  Javadoc had no similar counting system for things to be added when new changes are made. This was added. To me, it looks like the counts are still valid as the numbers seemed to match up.

column3: JavadocMetadataScraper fails silently if it can't write the XML files
column4: Identified through https://github.com/sevntu-checkstyle/sevntu.checkstyle/issues/857 ,  At https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/13481f2c410e4944ecf5ab93ec49948a523a0c82/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/meta/XmlMetaWriter.java#L179 , checkstyle will fail silently if there are no descriptions to write for the file it scrapped.  I was expecting the files to be generated, or give me an error why they couldn't be generated. Since there was no message and no files, this required me to debug through the code to find out why it wasn't generating my files or complaining.  I feel we should print an error message while continuing to process other files.  I also feel `MetadataGeneratorUtil` should report any errors back somehow so the client and calling tests can handle the situation appropriately.

column3: minor: remove and shrinks excess helper input files
minor: removed unnecessary inputs with no connections to tests

column4: Identified at https://github.com/rnveach/checkstyle/commits/token_order_check when checking which tokens appear out of order compared to the source,  ```` $ cat TestClass.java package com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.api.abstractcheck;  public class InputAvoidNoArgumentSuperConstructorCall extends java.util.ArrayList {     public InputAvoidNoArgumentSuperConstructorCall(int a, long b) {         super(/**/); // violation     } } ````  Produces the following piece of Tree that is in question from the command `java -jar checkstyle-8.45.1-all.jar -T TestClass.java`: ````     |  `--SLIST -> { [4:67]     |      |--SUPER_CTOR_CALL -> super [5:8]     |      |  |--LPAREN -> ( [5:13]     |      |  |--ELIST -> ELIST [5:18]     |      |  |--BLOCK_COMMENT_BEGIN -> /* [5:14]     |      |  |  |--COMMENT_CONTENT ->  [5:16]     |      |  |  `--BLOCK_COMMENT_END -> */ [5:15]     |      |  |--RPAREN -> ) [5:18]     |      |  `--SEMI -> ; [5:19] ````  The issue is that `COMMENT_CONTENT` says it comes after `BLOCK_COMMENT_END` which seems unnatural.  I would expect both tokens to have the same line/column since there is no contents, so it should act like a length of 0.

column3: XmlMetaReader fails if package given to it has no expected resource files listed
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/eclipse-cs/issues/256 when removing eclipse-cs meta files and trying to make a test to understand things more,  The stack trace: ```` net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactoryTest java.lang.ExceptionInInitializerError 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactoryTest.test(MetadataFactoryTest.java:35) ... Caused by: java.lang.IllegalStateException: com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.filefilters 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.meta.XmlMetaReader.readAllModulesIncludingThirdPartyIfAny(XmlMetaReader.java:85) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactory.createMetadataMap(MetadataFactory.java:582) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactory.doInitialization(MetadataFactory.java:559) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactory.refresh(MetadataFactory.java:539) 	at net.sf.eclipsecs.core.config.meta.MetadataFactory.(MetadataFactory.java:144) 	... 66 more Caused by: org.reflections.ReflectionsException: Scanner ResourcesScanner was not configured 	at org.reflections.Store.get(Store.java:39) 	at org.reflections.Store.get(Store.java:61) 	at org.reflections.Store.get(Store.java:56) 	at org.reflections.Reflections.getResources(Reflections.java:564) 	at org.reflections.Reflections.getResources(Reflections.java:572) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.meta.XmlMetaReader.readAllModulesIncludingThirdPartyIfAny(XmlMetaReader.java:83) 	... 70 more ```` (Checkstyle was modified in eclipse-cs to provide more error information in the stack trace to track down the issue)  Checkstyle's `XmlMetaReader` will throw this exception when it is given a package (valid or invalid) that contains no supporting resource files, which we are trying to match against `.*checkstylemeta-.*\\.xml`.  eclipse-cs has the packages `filters` and `filefilters` inside `checkstyle_packages.xml`. Though these are valid packages, they contain no checkstyle meta files when searching. When `filters` and `filefilters` are removed from `checkstyle_packages.xml`, the exception goes away, everything passes with no issues.  This is not an issue in eclipse-cs *currently* because eclipse-cs still has its own metadata resource files for these packages which I assume is preventing the library issue. Removing the files causes the exception to show up. This issue looks like it is preventing the completion of https://github.com/checkstyle/eclipse-cs/issues/256 and removing all eclipse-cs meta files.  This issue can occur outside eclipse-cs' files if a 3rd party check provides their own `checkstyle_packages.xml` with checks but provide no resource files in the package. As an example, they can put their checks in 1 folder and their meta files in another.  This issue was also confirmed in the library at https://github.com/ronmamo/reflections/issues/273 . It seems this issue is taking an extended time to get resolved, so it may be up to each user of the library to find accommodations around the issue.

column3: minor: restructures message testing to clarify messages come from
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10805 where it was noticed the class had no messages, but the test wasn't failing or documenting it.  Slightly redid the tests and util method to clarify when to scan super classes and when not to. Originally, the test was thinking `JavadocMetadataScraper` had messages from `AbstractJavadocCheck` which shouldn't be considered since those are parsing messages and not related to the check. The point of the test is to ensure all checks are logging some message and we are identifying it.

column3: Inline Config Parser throws complex exception without config in input file
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/pull/10758#discussion_r698910973 ,  Steps to reproduce: 1) Modify `InputParenPadNoStackoverflowError.java` to remove the configuration javadoc at the top of the file. 2) Run JUnit tests connected to the input file.  The following trimmed stack trace is printed: ```` Caused by: java.lang.IndexOutOfBoundsException: Index: 36, Size: 36 	at java.util.ArrayList.rangeCheck(ArrayList.java:657) 	at java.util.ArrayList.get(ArrayList.java:433) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.bdd.InlineConfigParser.setProperties(InlineConfigParser.java:206) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.bdd.InlineConfigParser.setModules(InlineConfigParser.java:122) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.bdd.InlineConfigParser.parse(InlineConfigParser.java:104) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.bdd.InlineConfigParser.parse(InlineConfigParser.java:88) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AbstractModuleTestSupport.verifyWithInlineConfigParser(AbstractModuleTestSupport.java:249) 	at com.puppycrawl.tools.checkstyle.AbstractModuleTestSupport.lambda$2(AbstractModuleTestSupport.java:380) 	at java.util.concurrent.FutureTask.run(FutureTask.java:266) 	at java.lang.Thread.run(Thread.java:748) ````  It is not clear what the issue is from the exception alone. I also question if the exception is actually coincidence that the tool is looking for any Javadoc and not the normal top most one.  An inexperienced user to our repo may not have any idea of our BDD and the requirement that the Javadoc configuration be inside our input files. This message gives no guidance on the issue and how to resolve.  https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/config/checkstyle_input_checks.xml#L20-L28 I understand we have a checkstyle item to print out the requirement of the BDD text, but that checkstyle item is only run after the tests and not before. Again, this doesn't help new users as they expect things to be clear when validated by the default order (which is currently compile, junits, IT, checks. external checks, etc...). Even outside the order, the users can build and debug their tests before even touching the checkstyle run.  We should change the parser to validate the necessity of the BDD text and it be in the correct location and remove the checkstyle item.  Additionally, the exception message should be made into clearer text on what the error is and guide new users on how to use it properly.

column3: RequireThisCheck: pattern variables produce false positives
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7504#issuecomment-974776332 ,  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class Test {     String p, s, n;      public static void main(String... arguments) {         new Test().run(arguments);     }      public void run(String... arguments) {         this.p = null;         this.s = null;         this.n = null;          Object o = 45;         if (!(o instanceof String p && p.equals("sd")) || !p.equals("wq")) { // only last p is instance variable             p = "a"; // instance var p         } else if (!(o instanceof Integer s && o instanceof String n)) {             p = "b"; // local var p             s = "b"; // instance var s             n = "b"; // instance var n         } else {             p = "c"; // local var p             s = 41; // local var s             n = "c"; // local var n         }          System.out.println(this.p + ":" + this.s + ":" + this.n);     } }  $ cat TestConfig.xml                            $ java -jar checkstyle-9.0.1-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... [ERROR] TestClass.java:14:35: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:14:40: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:14:60: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:15:13: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:16:43: Reference to instance variable 's' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:16:68: Reference to instance variable 'n' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:17:13: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:18:13: Reference to instance variable 's' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:19:13: Reference to instance variable 'n' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:21:13: Reference to instance variable 'p' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:22:13: Reference to instance variable 's' needs "this.". [RequireThis] [ERROR] TestClass.java:23:13: Reference to instance variable 'n' needs "this.". [RequireThis] Audit done. Checkstyle ends with 12 errors. ````  As the comments demonstrate, only really lines 14:60, 16, 19, and 20 should have violations as they are accessing the instance variables.  You can confirm this by running the code, which as is outputs `a:null:null`.  Thanks @nmancus1 for explaining all this to me.

column3: FinalLocalVariable: false negative on pattern variables
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/7504#issuecomment-974776332 ,   https://checkstyle.sourceforge.io/config_coding.html#FinalLocalVariable  ```` $ cat TestClass.java public class Test {     public void run(String... arguments) {         final Object o = 45;         if (o instanceof String p) { // line 4             System.out.println(p);         }         if (o instanceof final String p) { // line 7             System.out.println(p);         }         if (o instanceof String p) { // line 10             p = "rewrite";             System.out.println(p);         }     } }   $ cat TestConfig.xml                         $ java -jar checkstyle-9.0.1-all.jar -c TestConfig.xml TestClass.java Starting audit... Audit done. ````  I am expecting a violation on line 4 as line 7 shows that the pattern variables can be declared `final` and can be re-written as shown on line 11.  https://openjdk.java.net/jeps/394 > Lift the restriction that pattern variables are implicitly final, to reduce asymmetries between local variables and pattern variables.

column3: adds section for list of supported JREs
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/10886 , added a new section on the main page to display the list of JREs checkstyle is currently supported on so it is clear to users.

column3: MetadataGeneratorUtil should take the module folders as inputs
column4: Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/master/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/meta/MetadataGeneratorUtil.java#L83 ,  Not all repos have these same 3 folders. Sevntu for example only has `checks`. The way the code is written now, it is required to check all folders and those folders must exist. If those folders do not exist, for whatever reason, they an exception will be generated and the util will stop.  The Util should be changed so that those 3 folders are taken as required inputs and not hardcoded in.

Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/blob/13481f2c410e4944ecf5ab93ec49948a523a0c82/src/main/java/com/puppycrawl/tools/checkstyle/meta/JavadocMetadataScraper.java#L183-L185 ,  `JavadocMetadataScraper` thinks the name of the class is just "Check" instead of `CheckstyleTestMakeup`.  We have always identified check names by if they end with `Check` or not and just subtract that to get the name of the check.  `JavadocMetadataScraper` should follow this pattern instead of creating its own.

column3: Javadoc parser/grammar doesn't report the correct lines in Javadoc AST.
column4:
Identified at https://github.com/checkstyle-antlr4/checkstyle-antlr4/issues/15, ANTLR doesn't support the `` (pre-OSX macos) line ending any longer, and has no plans to add support. Therefore, when parsing a Javadoc in a file that uses the `` line ending, the line number never increases in the Javadoc:  ```java  public  class Test {     /**      * This is a javadoc comment.      * More info, on another line.      */     void doStuff() {      } }   ```  Unix utilities do not play well with ``, which renders as `^M` with `cat`:  ```bash  ➜  src cat -v Test.java  public  class Test {^M    /**^M     * This is a javadoc comment.^M     * More info, on another line.^M     */^M    void doStuff() {^M^M    }^M}^M%  ➜  src java -jar checkstyle-8.44-all.jar -J Test.java CLASS_DEF -> CLASS_DEF [1:0] |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [1:0] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [1:0] |--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [1:8] |--IDENT -> Test [1:14] `--OBJBLOCK -> OBJBLOCK [1:19]     |--LCURLY -> { [1:19]     |--METHOD_DEF -> METHOD_DEF [6:4]     |   |--MODIFIERS -> MODIFIERS [6:4]     |   |--TYPE -> TYPE [6:4]     |   |   |--BLOCK_COMMENT_BEGIN -> /* [2:4]     |   |   |   |--COMMENT_CONTENT -> *     * This is a javadoc comment.     * More info, on another line.      [2:6]     |   |   |   |   `--JAVADOC -> JAVADOC [2:7] // ok     |   |   |   |       |--NEWLINE ->  [2:7] // ok     |   |   |   |       |--LEADING_ASTERISK ->      * [2:8] // wrong, should be 3     |   |   |   |       |--TEXT ->  This is a javadoc comment. [2:14] // wrong, should be 3     |   |   |   |       |--NEWLINE ->  [2:41] // wrong, should be 3     |   |   |   |       |--LEADING_ASTERISK ->      * [2:42]  // wrong, should be 4     |   |   |   |       |--TEXT ->  More info, on another line. [2:48]  // wrong, should be 4     |   |   |   |       |--NEWLINE ->  [2:76]  // wrong, should be 4     |   |   |   |       |--TEXT ->       [2:77] // wrong, should be 5     |   |   |   |       `--EOF ->  [2:82] // wrong, should be 5     |   |   |   `--BLOCK_COMMENT_END -> */ [5:5]     |   |   `--LITERAL_VOID -> void [6:4]     |   |--IDENT -> doStuff [6:9]     |   |--LPAREN -> ( [6:16]     |   |--PARAMETERS -> PARAMETERS [6:17]     |   |--RPAREN -> ) [6:17]     |   `--SLIST -> { [6:19]     |       `--RCURLY -> } [8:4]     `--RCURLY -> } [9:0]  ```  As you can see, the Javadoc starts on line 2, but then the line number never advances within that Javadoc AST. This is because the `consume()` function in ANTLR's interpreter doesn't recognize the `` alone as a line ending any longer (it only looks for `
`, which covers the other two line endings). We should be able to handle any line ending that Java supports, which is ``, `
`, and `
`.   I would expect the Javadoc AST to track line numbers correctly. Similar issue was originally reported at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/2329, and problem was also noted at https://github.com/checkstyle/checkstyle/issues/2329#issuecomment-311235254.

column3: getText() misses a package part after using FullIdent.createFullIdent()
column4:
i'm writing a new check and found an issue when I use `FullIdent.createFullIdent().getText()`  I have the following java file ```java package test;  @Import(packages = { //         a.b.c.ClassA.class, //         b.c.ClassC.class, //         // comment         c.ClassB.class, // }) public class Test { } ``` which can be parsed successfully as I'm interested only in the annotation i have in the check ```java     @Override     public int[] getDefaultTokens() {         return new int[] { TokenTypes.ANNOTATION };     }      @Override     public boolean isCommentNodesRequired() {         return true;     } ``` now when visitToken is called I can print out the tree by using `AstTreeStringPrinter.printTree(ast)` resulting in  ```text |   |--ANNOTATION -> ANNOTATION [3:0] |   |   |--AT -> @ [3:0] |   |   |--IDENT -> Import [3:1] |   |   |--LPAREN -> ( [3:7] |   |   |--ANNOTATION_MEMBER_VALUE_PAIR -> ANNOTATION_MEMBER_VALUE_PAIR [3:8] |   |   |   |--IDENT -> packages [3:8] |   |   |   |--ASSIGN -> = [3:17] |   |   |   `--ANNOTATION_ARRAY_INIT -> { [3:19] |   |   |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [4:20] |   |   |       |   `--DOT -> . [4:20] |   |   |       |       |--DOT -> . [4:13] |   |   |       |       |   |--DOT -> . [4:11] |   |   |       |       |   |   |--DOT -> . [4:9] |   |   |       |       |   |   |   |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [3:21] |   |   |       |       |   |   |   |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT -> 
 [3:23] |   |   |       |       |   |   |   |--IDENT -> a [4:8] |   |   |       |       |   |   |   `--IDENT -> b [4:10] |   |   |       |       |   |   `--IDENT -> c [4:12] |   |   |       |       |   `--IDENT -> ClassA [4:14] |   |   |       |       `--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [4:21] |   |   |       |--COMMA -> , [4:26] |   |   |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [5:18] |   |   |       |   `--DOT -> . [5:18] |   |   |       |       |--DOT -> . [5:11] |   |   |       |       |   |--DOT -> . [5:9] |   |   |       |       |   |   |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [4:28] |   |   |       |       |   |   |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT -> 
 [4:30] |   |   |       |       |   |   |--IDENT -> b [5:8] |   |   |       |       |   |   `--IDENT -> c [5:10] |   |   |       |       |   `--IDENT -> ClassC [5:12] |   |   |       |       `--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [5:19] |   |   |       |--COMMA -> , [5:24] |   |   |       |--EXPR -> EXPR [7:16] |   |   |       |   `--DOT -> . [7:16] |   |   |       |       |--DOT -> . [7:9] |   |   |       |       |   |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [5:26] |   |   |       |       |   |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT -> 
 [5:28] |   |   |       |       |   |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [6:8] |   |   |       |       |   |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT ->  comment
 [6:10] |   |   |       |       |   |--IDENT -> c [7:8] |   |   |       |       |   `--IDENT -> ClassB [7:10] |   |   |       |       `--LITERAL_CLASS -> class [7:17] |   |   |       |--COMMA -> , [7:22] |   |   |       |--SINGLE_LINE_COMMENT -> // [7:24] |   |   |       |   `--COMMENT_CONTENT -> 
 [7:26] |   |   |       `--RCURLY -> } [8:0] |   |   `--RPAREN -> ) [8:1] |   `--LITERAL_PUBLIC -> public [9:0] ``` while walking through the tree I create a FullIdent via `FullIdent.createFullIdent(value)` while `value` contains the DetailAST of `. [4x20]`. calling `getText()` on the FullIdent returns `//.a.c.ClassA.class` where the package identifier `b` is now missing, in the tree we can see it is there -> `b [4:10]` but in the string representation it is missing  also, a little bit strange is the prefixing with `//.` but I assume this is coming from the single-line comment that is part of the innermost DeatilAST
